headline: Employee Relations Specialist at U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE)

positions.description:
- Proven advisor to top executives of multiple, diverse organizations of up to 7,500 employees. Provided experienced counsel in the development of strategic objectives, policy and administration, manpower management, workforce preservation and security, risk management, equal opportunity, and organizational climate.  
 - Trusted to interpret and apply policy to resolve work related disputes and grievances concerning compensation, benefits, performance, employee relations, and conflict resolution.  
 - Advocated employee well-being by managing prevention programs for substance abuse, suicide prevention, sexual assault, domestic violence, family advocacy and readiness, and work related stress.  Served on multidiscipline committee consisting of lawyers, criminal investigators, family counselors, and command representatives regarding incidents of domestic violence.
 - Served as lead facilitator for all employee professional development.  Designed and delivered instruction on military history, current events, and emerging concepts, utilizing various forms of media and training aids to more than 1,200 midlevel employees. 
 - Designed, managed, and served as key leader for professional development and career progression initiatives to include volunteer community service programs and small unit leadership councils. 
- Routinely conducted or directed occupational safety and health assessments of base facilities, training areas and range complexes, port facilities, and housing and group living areas to ensure compliance with all applicable regulations.  
- Conducted detailed site safety and health inspections, incident and injury/illness investigations, and made recommendations for process improvement and hazard mitigation.
positions.title: Sergeant Major / First Sergeant (Principal Technical Advisor)

positions.companyName: Marine Corps Drill Instructor / Operations Manager / Chief Instructor (Training and Development)

- Recognized for immeasurable contributions to the recruit training process, resulting the highest training statistics of 14 companies.    
- Developed and implemented a two-day alternate training program to provide deficient employees assistance in completing recruit training requirements resulting in a 75 percent success rate.

Resulted in dramatically increased trust in the company leadership, job satisfaction and decreased marital problems.
